bibl.title: Letter from Earl Spielmacher to Philip Showalter Hench, November 1, 1940

div1.p: Spielmacher explains that the pictures of the Dean Memorial Bridge plaque sent to Hench are of poor quality because the plaque has deteriorated.

div1.head: Letter from Earl Spielmacher to Philip Showalter Hench, November 1, 1940
div1.opener:
The GRAND RAPIDS
CAMERA SHOP INC.
PHOTOGRAPHIC
APPARATUS
and SUPPLIES
52 MONROE AVE.
Grand Rapids, Mich.
November 1, 1940
PHONE 8-6877
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
Referring to your letter of recent date,
I assure you that no better picture can be od-
tained of the plaque on Dean Bridge. As it was,
our photographer spent considerable time in wash-
ing and polishing the plaque before the picture
was taken. The print sent is as sharp as can be
obtained, bearing in mind that thru a period of
years the plaque has accumulated considerable
corrosion which of course, makes it impossible
to secure a picture which is as sharp as you would
like to have it.

We trust that with this explanation you
will feel beeter satisfied with the pictures sent
you.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Grand Rapids Camera Shop, Inc.
Earl Spielmacher
&
Staff Photographer S/s
